Claude's Question/Concern: Where exactly should the chat be positioned? Full left side or left 60%?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Left side takes 60% of screen. Right side 40% shows: (top) topic list with status colors + (bottom) simple analytics card

Claude's Question/Concern: Should chat ALWAYS be visible even when viewing analytics dashboards? Or only on main view?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Chat is always visible on left for ALL views. Right side changes: conversation view = topics list; analytics view = charts; board view = kanban. Chat never goes away.

Claude's Question/Concern: On mobile we can't show chat + topics side by side. Tabs or bottom sheet?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Propose: Bottom nav with 3 tabs: Chat / Topics / Analytics. Swipe between them. When in Chat and AI suggests topics a floating button appears to quick-view them.

Claude's Question/Concern: Which parts of current mock should I keep vs rebuild?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Keep: topic detail modal design + status badges + category pills + the overall color scheme. Rebuild: remove sidebar navigation + remove top header buttons + make chat the main interface.

Claude's Question/Concern: The current conversation view shows topics as cards. Should right-side topic list be: (A) Compact list with title+status or (B) Cards like current view?
Should chat look like: (A) ChatGPT style (centered messages grey/blue) or (B) Claude style (full width with subtle background) or (C) Something else?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Recommend Claude style - cleaner for long conversations. User messages light background right-aligned AI messages no background left-aligned.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should message input be: (A) Bottom of chat panel with send button or (B) Floating at bottom with attachments button?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Bottom of chat panel fixed position. Send button + small icon for future file attachments. Auto-resize textarea up to 5 lines.

Claude's Question/Concern: When should AI suggest creating topics? (A) After every AI response (B) When user asks (C) After detecting pattern shift?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Hybrid: AI analyzes after response. If 2+ distinct subjects detected it shows suggestion banner at top of chat: Create 2 topics? [Subject 1] [Subject 2] [Dismiss]. User can edit titles before creating.

Claude's Question/Concern: If AI suggests topics mid-conversation how do we show it without interrupting flow?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Inline suggestion bubble appears above chat input: I noticed we discussed 3 things: [API Design] [Database Choice] [Error Handling] ‚Üí [Create Topics] [Not Now]. Non-blocking stays there until dismissed.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should AI auto-create topics or always ask user first?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Always ask first for MVP. Auto-create comes later as a user preference. Users need to trust the system before it acts autonomously.

Claude's Question/Concern: When linking a message to a topic how do we handle one message mentioning multiple topics?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Many-to-many relationship: One message can link to multiple topics. Store relevance score per link (0-100). When viewing a topic only show messages with relevance > 30%. UI: Topic chips appear above/below message.

Claude's Question/Concern: How should we visually show which messages relate to which topics in the chat?
Claude's Proposed Solution: When hovering over a topic in right panel highlight related messages in chat with colored left border (topic's color). When hovering message show small topic pills inline.

Claude's Question/Concern: Current mock has status dropdown in modal. Should we also have quick status change in topic list?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Yes - both places. Topic list: click status badge to open dropdown (open ‚Üí in-progress ‚Üí resolved ‚Üí archived). Modal: dropdown like current design.

Claude's Question/Concern: Where should we show documents/artifacts that AI creates? In chat or separate panel?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Show inline in chat as a special message type with preview card. Click to expand full screen overlay (like Claude artifacts). Preview shows: doc icon title snippet [View Full] button.
Notes: Steve has experience with this in other app

Claude's Question/Concern: How should user edit artifacts? Inline editing or separate editor?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Full screen editor overlay. Left = editable document (markdown or code editor) Right = outline/structure navigator. Save button or auto-save every 2sec.

Claude's Question/Concern: Steve mentioned splitting docs into sections in JSON. What's the structure?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Need Steve to share structure from other app. Propose: {type: document sections: [{id: s1 title: heading content: markdown order: 1}] version: 1}. AI only regenerates specific sections not whole doc.
Notes: STEVE: Please share your JSON structure example

Claude's Question/Concern: How should commenting on artifacts work? Inline comments or sidebar?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Hybrid: Click any section ‚Üí comment sidebar slides from right. Comments anchored to section ID. Shows: user avatar comment text timestamp. Reply threading.

Claude's Question/Concern: When user comments on artifact section should that auto-create a topic or ask?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Ask first. Show suggestion: This comment could be tracked as a topic: [Use JWT tokens] ‚Üí [Create Topic] [Just Comment]. If Create Topic the comment becomes first response in topic.

Claude's Question/Concern: You said 1-2 simple analytics for MVP. What specifically?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Minimum: (1) Topic count by status (pie chart) (2) Recent activity timeline (last 7 days bar chart). Optional: (3) Topics by category (bar chart).
Notes: STEVE: What metrics matter most to you?

Claude's Question/Concern: Should analytics update in real-time as topics created or only on page load?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Update immediately when topic created/status changed. Use simple state management no polling needed since it's same client session.

Claude's Question/Concern: Current mock has global search. Should search cover: (A) Just topics (B) Topics + chat messages (C) Everything including artifacts?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Everything. Search box in top bar. Results grouped: Messages (with context) Topics (with status) Artifacts (with preview). Click result to jump to location.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should categories be: (A) Predefined dropdown (technical design business) or (B) Free text tags or (C) Both?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Both. Predefined categories for consistency + free-form tags for flexibility. Categories are single-select tags are multi-select. AI suggests both when creating topic.

Claude's Question/Concern: Do we need priority field (high/medium/low) or is status enough?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Keep priority for MVP. Users think in terms of what's urgent. Shows as colored indicator: üî¥ high üü° medium ‚ö™ low. AI infers from language (ASAP urgent critical = high).

Claude's Question/Concern: Should AI auto-detect when topics are related and link them? Or manual only?
Claude's Proposed Solution: AI suggests relationships but user confirms. When creating new topic if AI detects similarity (>60% embedding match) show: Similar topics: [API Authentication] [JWT Implementation] ‚Üí [Link as Related?].

Claude's Question/Concern: Current mock has project selector. Do we need multi-project in MVP or single project?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Single project for MVP. Removes complexity. Add project switching in Phase 2. Just have one default project per user.

Claude's Question/Concern: What export formats needed? Markdown? PDF? JSON?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Markdown for MVP: Export conversation as .md file with topics as H2 sections. Export single topic as .md. JSON export for backup/migration (raw data). PDF nice-to-have for Phase 2.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should we save to Turso on every message or batch save?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Save every message immediately. Also save draft messages to localStorage so user doesn't lose text if browser crashes. Turso is fast enough for immediate writes.

Claude's Question/Concern: How far back should undo go? Just last action or full history?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Store last 20 actions in memory: message sent topic created status changed topic deleted. Simple [Undo] link appears for 5 seconds after action. After 5 sec action is permanent.

Claude's Question/Concern: If Gemini API fails (rate limit network error) what's the UX?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Show error in chat: ‚ö†Ô∏è AI temporarily unavailable. Your message is saved. [Retry] [Use Offline Model]. Queue message to retry in 30sec. Fallback to Ollama if available.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should app work offline at all? Or require internet?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Require internet for MVP. Offline mode needs service workers + local model + sync logic = too complex. Show friendly message: üì° You're offline. Reconnecting‚Ä¶

Claude's Question/Concern: How should we show AI is thinking? Typing indicator? Skeleton?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Typing indicator: Three animated dots below last message (like iMessage). Appears immediately when user hits send. Shows while waiting for API response.

Claude's Question/Concern: When user first opens app (no messages no topics) what do they see?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Chat shows: Welcome message + 3 example prompts as clickable buttons: Help me design an API Review this architecture Draft a technical spec. Topics panel shows: No topics yet. They'll appear as you chat.

Claude's Question/Concern: Can user edit their sent messages? Or only delete/resend?
Claude's Proposed Solution: No editing sent messages for MVP (too complex with AI context). User can delete last message + AI response then resend. Simple [Delete] icon on message hover.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should we limit how many messages display in chat? Infinite scroll or pagination?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Infinite scroll loading oldest messages as user scrolls up. Initially load last 50 messages. Virtual scrolling if performance issue (unlikely for MVP).

Claude's Question/Concern: How do we handle when conversation exceeds Gemini's context limit?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Gemini Flash 2.0 has 2M tokens (~1.5M words) so unlikely to hit in MVP. If we do: Summarize older messages keep last 20 full. Store full conversation in DB always just send summarized version to AI.

Claude's Question/Concern: What system prompt should we use for the AI assistant?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Need Steve's input on AI personality. Propose: You are a helpful AI assistant for project discussions. Analyze conversations to identify distinct topics decisions and action items. Be concise and ask clarifying questions.
Notes: STEVE: What AI personality/tone do you want?

Claude's Question/Concern: How should AI generate topic titles? User can edit but what's the default?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Extract 3-6 word title capturing core subject. Format: Noun + descriptive phrase (API error handling strategy) not sentences (How should we handle API errors?). User can always edit.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should topics have both title AND description? Or just title?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Both. Title is short (shown in list). Description is 1-2 sentences (shown in modal) providing context. AI generates both but user can edit.

Claude's Question/Concern: Any keyboard shortcuts needed?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Essential ones: ‚åò+K = focus search ‚åò+Enter = send message Escape = close modal Tab = navigate ‚åò+/ = show shortcuts. Power users love shortcuts.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should app have notifications? (New topic created AI finished thinking)
Claude's Proposed Solution: Toast notifications only for MVP. Small popup bottom-right: ‚úì Topic created Successfully exported Error occurred. Auto-dismiss after 3 seconds.

Claude's Question/Concern: Current mock is light mode. Do we need dark mode for MVP?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Skip dark mode for MVP. Add in Phase 2. Significantly increases CSS work. Most PM/tech tools used during day anyway.

Claude's Question/Concern: At what screen size should we switch to mobile layout?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Desktop: 1024px+ (chat left topics right). Tablet: 768-1023px (collapsible panels). Mobile: <768px (tabs at bottom). Test on: iPhone SE desktop 1920px.

Claude's Question/Concern: Should we keep current demo or create new repo for real MVP?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Keep same repo. Create /mvp folder for new Next.js app. Keep /current for demo reference. Cleaner than new repo keeps history. Can delete demo later.

Claude's Question/Concern: Build features in what order?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Week 1: Chat UI + Gemini integration + Turso schema. Week 2: Topic creation + linking. Week 3: Topic list + detail view + status. Week 4: Artifact display + commenting. Week 5: Analytics + polish.
Notes: STEVE: Does this order make sense?

Claude's Question/Concern: Manual testing or automated tests for MVP?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Manual testing for MVP. You test + I fix. Add tests in Phase 2. Jest + React Testing Library for Next.js when we scale.

Claude's Question/Concern: Where to deploy MVP? Vercel?
Claude's Proposed Solution: Vercel for frontend (free auto-deploy from GitHub). Turso for DB (free tier). Domain: exelentthreads.vercel.app or custom domain if you have one?
Notes: STEVE: Do you have a domain?

Claude's Question/Concern: What API keys/secrets needed?
Claude's Proposed Solution: GEMINI_API_KEY = Gemini API key. TURSO_DATABASE_URL = Turso connection. TURSO_AUTH_TOKEN = Turso auth. Store in .env.local not committed. You'll need to create both.
